title: Frequently Asked Questions
subtitle: Everything you need to know about the cottage, facilities and bookings

stillHaveQuestions.heading: Still Have Questions?
stillHaveQuestions.description: Didn't find the answer you were looking for? Contact us directly and we'll be happy to help!

q1.question: What is the maximum capacity of the cottage?
q1.answer: The cottage can accommodate up to 8 people. We have 3 bedrooms with beds for 6 people + a sofa bed in the living room for exceptional cases.

q2.question: What is the check-in and check-out policy?
q2.answer: Check-in: {checkIn}. Check-out: {checkOut}. For late check-in or extended check-out, please contact us in advance - we will try to accommodate your requests based on availability.

q3.question: Are pets allowed?
q3.answer: No, unfortunately we do not accept pets. This measure is taken for the comfort of all guests, including those with allergies.

q4.question: Is parking available?
q4.answer: Yes, we have free private parking for up to 3 cars in the cottage yard. The parking is paved and lit at night.

q5.question: Are the hot tub and sauna included in the price?
q5.answer: Yes, both the hot tub and Finnish sauna are included in the accommodation price. Firewood for heating the hot tub is also included. We will show you how to use them at check-in.

q6.question: Is WiFi available?
q6.answer: Yes, we offer free high-speed WiFi throughout the cottage. The speed is sufficient for streaming, video conferencing and remote work.

q7.question: How is access to the cottage in winter?
q7.answer: The road to the cottage is accessible year-round. In winter, in case of heavy snowfall, we recommend having winter tires. The last kilometer is on a forest road, but it is regularly maintained.

q8.question: Is the kitchen fully equipped?
q8.answer: Yes, the kitchen is fully equipped with stove, oven, refrigerator, dishwasher, coffee maker, kettle, cooking utensils and cutlery. You only need to bring food.

attractions.avrigValley: Avrig Valley – tourist area stretching along the Avrig River, with cabins, guesthouses and peaceful mountain landscapes
attractions.poianaNea: Poiana Neamțului – end point of the valley and starting place for mountain trails to Bârcaciu, Suru, Lake Avrig
attractions.lakeAvrig: Lake Avrig (2011 m alt.) – spectacular glacial lake, one of the most beautiful in the Făgăraș Mountains
attractions.trail1: Avrig → Izvorul Florii → Suru → Lake Avrig → Negoiu → Bâlea
attractions.trail2: Poiana Neamțului → Bârcaciu Cabin → Lake Avrig → Suru
attractions.trail3: Trails to peaks: Negoiu (2535m), Suru (2281m), Budislavu (2345m), Ciortea (2426m), Scara (2213m)
attractions.brukenthal: Brukenthal Palace – baroque palace with park, alleys and historical areas
attractions.museum: Avrig Museum – collections of folk art, glassware, Gheorghe Lazăr exhibitions
attractions.evangelical: Evangelical Church (1265–1295) – the oldest monument in Avrig
attractions.orthodox: Orthodox Church (1762) – valuable paintings by masters Ionașcu and Pană
attractions.carta: Cârța Cistercian Monastery – ruined medieval Gothic ensemble, very well known (19th century)
attractions.calendar: The Calendar Story – theme park with 12 houses inspired by the traditional calendar
attractions.clay: Clay Castle – Fairy Valley – one of the most photographed destinations in Romania
attractions.brambura: Brambura Park & Upside Down House – family attraction
attractions.panoramic: Panoramic Park & Viking Village – theme park

q10.question: Do I need to bring bed linen and towels?
q10.answer: No, bed linen and towels are included in the price and are provided for each guest. If you need extra towels for the hot tub/sauna, please let us know.

q11.question: Are there shops or restaurants nearby?
q11.answer: The nearest restaurant, Popasul Montan, is 3 minutes away by car or 5 min to Ghiocelul restaurant. In {city} (7.5 km) you will find supermarkets, stores and butcher shops. We recommend stocking up before arriving at the cottage.

q12.question: Is there phone signal?
q12.answer: Yes, there is signal for major networks (Orange, Vodafone, Telekom). Signal strength may vary depending on the operator. WiFi is available as an alternative for communication.
